page.title: 15PLANTATION
page.content:
{PLANTATIONS AT WINESTEAD}
Thorp's plantation, consisting of 30.92 acres was sold for Â£1 in 1932. It is now owned by Manor Farm, Winestead consisting mainly of Ash, Oak, Sycamore, Alder, Chestnut, Wild Cherry and Scotch Pine trees. All Elm trees have been felled because of Dutch Elm disease. Rabbits, foxes, pheasants and deer all roam freely. Part of Thorp's plantation is "Thorp's pond", being 0.32 acres with ducks and heron to be seen. Also sighted are red shanks, woodpecker and sandpipers. The owners of Manor Farm are purchasing Westfield plantation, which actually joins Thorp's plantation, being 10.18 acres of conifers. On 24th June 1984 a Preservation Order was placed on the Westfield plantation preventing anyone from felling trees.
